Children born on Ukrainian soil regardle: Children born on Ukrainian soil regardles of citizenship of their parents are considered Ukrainian citizens by birth (Article 7)
Children who have at least one parent wh: Children who have at least one parent who is Ukrainian citizen regardles of place of birth are considered Ukrainian citizens by birth (Article 7)
Definitive answer is given in Law on Cit: Definitive answer is given in Law on Citizenship
Everybody who has a parent or grandparen: Everybody who has a parent or grandparent that was born or at least lived on territory that was part of Ukraine before 1991 can become Ukrainian citizen (Article 8)
Person that immigrated to Ukraine can ap: Person that immigrated to Ukraine can apply for citizenship after 5 years (Article 9)
Person that is currently in marriage wit: Person that is currently in marriage with Ukrainian citizen that was registered more than 2 years ago can apply for citizenship (Article 9)
Person that served for 3 years in Armed: Person that served for 3 years in Armed Forces can apply for citizenship (Article 9)
To sum it up - marriage for 2 years, arm: To sum it up - marriage for 2 years, army for 3 years, 5 years of residence or your grandparents were originally from here
Person that renounced Ukrainian citizens: Person that renounced Ukrainian citizenship can restore it (Article 10)
If nothing applies to you - see \"immigr: If nothing applies to you - see "immigration" below

There are however major differences in p.People who have it by birth go and ask: People who have it by birth go and ask authorities to register the fact, people who have ancestors can accept citizenship or not and everybody else asks President to grant them citizenship

Why would you get Ukrainian citizenship?: Why would you get Ukrainian citizenship?
Definitive answer is given in Law on Imm: Definitive answer is given in Law on Immigration
Person that is currently in marriage wit: Person that is currently in marriage with Ukrainian citizen that was registered more than 2 years ago can get permanent residence permit
Everybody who has a parent or grandparen: Everybody who has a parent or grandparent that was born or at least lived on territory that was part of Ukraine before 1991 can get permanent residence permit
Parents and children of Ukrainian citize: Parents and children of Ukrainian citizens can get permanent residence permit
Ministries can petition for person to ge: Ministries can petition for person to get residence permit on the grounds of national interest
Person of Ukrainian origin, their spouse: Person of Ukrainian origin, their spouse and children can get permanents residence permit
Siblings that share both parents with Uk: Siblings that share both parents with Ukrainian citizen, grandchildren and grandparents of Ukrainian citizens can get permanent residence permit (subject to quotas)
People that invested 100 thousand dollar: People that invested 100 thousand dollars in Ukraine can get permanent residence permit (subject to quotas)
Scientists and cultural figures can get: Scientists and cultural figures can get permanent residence permit on the grounds of national initirest if supported by petition from respective ministry (subject to quotas)
Highly qualified workers and specilists: Highly qualified workers and specilists can get permanent residence permit (subject to quotas)
Spouse, parents and underage children of: Spouse, parents and underage children of permanent residence permit holder can get permanents residence permit as well (subject to quotas)
Person that served for 3 years in Armed: Person that served for 3 years in Armed Forces can get permanent residence permit (subject to quotas)
Victims of human trafficing that lived i: Victims of human trafficing that lived in Ukraine for 3 years since moment they recognised as such (subject to quotas)
Person that renounces Ukrainian citizens: Person that renounces Ukrainian citizenship automatically gets permanent residence permit
If nothing applies to you - see \"tempor: If nothing applies to you - see "temporary stay" below"
Who can legally stay in Ukraine more tha: Who can legally stay in Ukraine more than 90 days
Definitive answer is given in Law on For: Definitive answer is given in Law on Foreign Citizens and Stateless People
Person that is currently in marriage wit: Person that is currently in marriage with Ukrainian citizen regardless of date it was registered can get temporary residence permit
Students, religious missionaries, journa: Students, religious missionaries, journalists and employees of foreign companies and banks with branches in Ukraine can get temporary residence permit
Owner of company registered in Ukraine t: Owner of company registered in Ukraine that contributed more than 100 thousand dollars to paid-in capital can get temporary residence permit
Employees of Ukrainian companies can get: Employees of Ukrainian companies can get temporary resince permit for duration of their employment
Why would you get permanents residence p: Why would you get permanents residence permit?
Why would you get temporary residence pe: Why would you get temporary residence permit?
